title: Open Source Cloud and Middleware Provider WSO2 Joins Open Invention Network, World's Largest Patent Non-Aggression Community
content:
[September 01, 2015]   
    
  

 WSO2, provider of the only fully integrated, 100% open source cloud and 
 middleware platform, has joined the Open Invention Network (OIN), an 
 organization dedicated to defending the Linux ecosystem and fostering 
 sustainable collaboration around open source software. OIN facilitates 
 the world's largest patent non-aggression community, with nearly 1,700 
 members, and undertakes a range of activities to support freedom of 
 choice around open technology. 
 

 As an OIN licensee, WSO2 joins other community members in royalty-free 
 cross-licensing over Linux System technology, foregoing patent disputes 
 between member organizations around defined Linux and adjacent 
 technologies. 
 

 "Since WSO2 was founded, we have been committed to delivering a 
 completely open source platform that takes advantage of the Linux 
 ecosystem," said Jonathan Marsh, WSO2 vice president of strategy. "The 
 Open Invention Network's recent expansion in scope was a significant 
 step in covering the technologies that we and our customers rely on to 
 drive their enterprise, cloud, mobile and Internet of Things 
 applications. As an OIN member, we look forward not only to taking 
 advantage of the cross-licensing opportunities but also working with OIN 
 to expand further extend the scope of technologies in the patent pool." 
 

 "We are pleased that WSO2, a leader in open source enterprise middleware 
 and cloud platform solutions, has joined the OIN community to support 
 collaboration around the Linux ecosystem, the foundation for innovation 
 in the cloud, mobile and the Internet of Things," said Shane Coughlan, 
 OIN global director of licensing. 
 

 OIN CEO Keith Bergelt added, "We applaud WSO2 for deepening its 
 commitment to open innovation by participating in our community and 
 pledging patent non-aggression over Lnux and core open source 
 technologies."

 About Open Invention Network  
 

 Open Invention Network (OIN) is the largest patent non-aggression 
 community in history and supports freedom of action in Linux as a key 
 element of open source software. Funded by Google, IBM, NEC, Philips,  Red Hat ( News - Alert ) , Sony and SUSE, OIN has more than 1,700 OIN community members 
 and owns more than 1,000 global patents and applications. The OIN patent 
 license and member cross-licenses are available royalty free to any 
 party that joins the OIN community. For more information, visit http://www.openinventionnetwork.com . 
 
 About WSO2  
 

 WSO2 uniquely delivers on the promise of the connected business. It 
 offers the only completely integrated enterprise platform that enables 
 businesses to build, integrate, manage, secure and analyze their APIs, 
 applications, and Web services-on-premises, in the cloud, on mobile 
 devices, and across the Internet of Things. Leading enterprise customers 
 worldwide rely on WSO2's award-winning 100% open source platform and its 
 robust performance and governance for their mission-critical 
 applications. Today, these businesses represent nearly every sector: 
 health, financial, retail, logistics, manufacturing, travel, technology, 
 telecom and more. Visit http://wso2.com 
 to learn more, or check out the WSO2 community on the WSO2 
 Blog , Twitter ,  LinkedIn , 
 and Facebook .
